_comment: Pelican Panel Egg for Hybrowse Hytale Server - COMPLETE VERSION
name: Hytale Pelican
author: scotthowson
description:
Production-ready Hytale server powered by Hybrowse's Docker image.

Features:
• Automatic downloads with smart update detection
• Built-in CurseForge mod management
• Automatic backups
• Security-first design

AUTHENTICATION REQUIRED:
1. First start: Watch console for device code URL (downloader auth)
2. After server starts: Use console commands for server auth
   - /auth persistence Encrypted
   - /auth login device
   - Follow URL + device code
   - /auth select <number> (if multiple profiles)
   - /auth status (to verify)

Docs: https://github.com/Hybrowse/hytale-server-docker/blob/main/docs/image/quickstart.md

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
##
## Hybrowse Hytale Server - Installation Script for Pelican Panel
##
set -e

cd /mnt/server

echo ""
echo "==========================================="
echo "  Hybrowse Hytale Server - Installation"
echo "==========================================="
echo ""
echo "Setting up directory permissions..."
echo "  Container UID: 1000 (hytale user)"
echo ""

# Hybrowse container runs as UID 1000
# Pelican typically runs containers as a different UID
# We need to ensure the directory is writable by UID 1000
chown -R 1000:1000 /mnt/server || echo "Note: Could not set ownership to 1000:1000 (may require admin)"
chmod -R 755 /mnt/server

echo ""
echo "This egg uses the Hybrowse Docker image which handles:"
echo "  ✓ Automatic server file downloads"
echo "  ✓ Smart update detection (downloads only when needed)"
echo "  ✓ CurseForge mod management (optional)"
echo "  ✓ Automatic backups (optional)"
echo ""
echo "Installation complete!"
echo ""
echo "==========================================="
echo "  IMPORTANT: Two-Step Authentication"
echo "==========================================="
echo ""
echo "STEP 1: Downloader Authentication (First Start)"
echo "  - Start your server and watch the console"
echo "  - You'll see a URL and device code"
echo "  - Visit the URL and enter the code"
echo "  - Download will proceed automatically"
echo "  - Credentials stored for future starts"
echo ""
echo "STEP 2: Server Authentication (After Startup)"
echo "  - Once server boots, open the console"
echo "  - Run: /auth persistence Encrypted"
echo "  - Run: /auth login device"
echo "  - Follow the URL + device code shown"
echo "  - If multiple profiles: /auth select <number>"
echo "  - Verify with: /auth status"
echo ""
echo "After both steps, players can connect!"
echo ""
echo "Documentation:"
echo "  https://github.com/Hybrowse/hytale-server-docker"
echo "==========================================="
echo ""

variables.name: Auto Download Server Files
variables.description: Automatically download Hytale server files on first run using the official Hytale Downloader. Requires authentication via device code on first start.

variables.name: Auto Update
variables.description: Check for server updates on startup. Downloads only when updates are available.

variables.name: Server Port
variables.description: UDP port for Hytale server (QUIC protocol). Must match your Pelican allocation.

variables.name: Machine ID
variables.description: 32-character hex string for hardware UUID (auto-generated if not set). Used for encrypted credential storage. Only change if migrating servers.

variables.name: JVM Min Memory
variables.description: Minimum JVM heap size (e.g., 2G, 4G). Leave empty to omit -Xms flag.

variables.name: JVM Max Memory
variables.description: Maximum JVM heap size (e.g., 4G, 8G, 16G). This is your main memory allocation.

variables.name: JVM Extra Arguments
variables.description: Additional JVM arguments for advanced tuning. Leave empty for defaults.

variables.name: Use AOT Cache
variables.description: Use Ahead-Of-Time compilation cache for faster startup. Recommended: true

variables.name: Server Name
variables.description: Display name for your Hytale server

variables.name: Max Players
variables.description: Maximum number of concurrent players

variables.name: View Distance
variables.description: View distance in chunks (12 chunks = 384 blocks). Higher values require more RAM.

variables.name: Authentication Mode
variables.description: Server authentication mode. AUTHENTICATED requires player authentication. OFFLINE allows anyone to join. INSECURE is for testing only.

variables.name: Enable Backups
variables.description: Enable automatic server backups

variables.name: Backup Frequency (Minutes)
variables.description: How often to create backups. Only applies if backups are enabled.

variables.name: Backup Retention Count
variables.description: Maximum number of backups to keep. Oldest backups are automatically deleted.

variables.name: Backup Directory
variables.description: Directory path for backups (inside container). Default is /data/backups

variables.name: CurseForge Mods
variables.description:
Space or newline-separated list of CurseForge mod IDs or ID:FileID pairs.

Examples:
• 123456 (latest version of mod)
• 123456:3456789 (specific file)
• Multiple: 123456 234567 345678

variables.name: CurseForge API Key
variables.description:
Your CurseForge API key for mod downloads. Get one at https://console.curseforge.com/

NOTE: If key starts with $2a$10$, you'll need to escape it in some contexts.

variables.name: CurseForge Auto Update Mods
variables.description: Automatically check for and download mod updates on server startup

variables.name: CurseForge Release Channel
variables.description: Which release channels to accept for mod downloads

variables.name: CurseForge Game Version Filter
variables.description: Filter mods by game version (optional). Leave empty to accept all versions.

variables.name: Allow Self-Op
variables.description: Allow players to use /op command to give themselves operator permissions. WARNING: This grants full admin access!

variables.name: Validate Assets
variables.description: Exit with error if server assets are invalid. Useful for catching corruption.

variables.name: Validate World Generation
variables.description: Exit with error if world generation config is invalid

variables.name: Debug Logging
variables.description: Enable debug-level logging for troubleshooting
